spirit:addressBlock.spirit:name: some_register_map
spirit:addressBlock.spirit:description: This address map contains some example registers to show how RDL can be utilized in various situations.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SOFT_RST
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset dsi module 1 = reset dsi module 0 = de-assert software reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SOFT_RST_REG
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset config registers 1 = reset dsi config registers to default values 0 = de-assert reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CLR_PHY_FIFO
spirit:field.spirit:description: configure clear phy tx fifo 1 = clear fifo data to 0 0 = de-assert clear. it is not used currently and reserved for future use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_RST_TXLP
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset lp tx submodule 1 = reset lp tx module 0 = de-assert software reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_RST_CPU
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset cpu tx submodule 1 = reset cpu tx module 0 = de-assert software reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_RST_CPN
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset cpn tx submodule 1 = reset cpn tx module 0 = de-assert software reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_RST_VPN
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset video panel submodule 1 = reset vpn module 0 = de-assert software reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DSI_PHY_RST
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset dphy submodule 1 = reset dphy 0 = de-assert software reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DSI_HCLK_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi ahb clock disable. dsi config registers can still be written or read even if dsi ahb clock is disabled. 1 = dsi ahb clock will be gated 0 = dsi ahb clock is passed to dsi module

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DSI_CLK_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi clock disable 1 = dsi clock will be gated 0 = dsi clock is passed to dsi module

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_TX_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: video panel interface tx enable 1 = enable video panel tx packet to dphy. dsi will send video packets to peripheral. 0 = disable video panel interface tx.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_SLV
spirit:field.spirit:description: video panel interface in slave mode 1 = video panel work in slave mode, and it will receive vsync from input lcd interface, and use it to control the internal timing. 0 = video panel interface works in master mode. dsi will send vsync to lcd module and control the v timing and h timing. this bit must set to 1, vpn just support slave mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel interface enable 1 = command panel is running and can accept data from the command panel interface 0 = disable command panel interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: video panel interface enable 1 = video panel is running. 0 = disable video panel interface. setting this field to 1 will star the video panel timing.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_EOTP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: eotp enable 1 = enable eotp packet 0 = disable eotp packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_VCH_NO
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel virtual channel number

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_VCH_NO
spirit:field.spirit:description: video panel virtual channel number for active panel 1 this parameter defines the virtual channel number for vpn

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_HS_RXP
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hstx contention rxp error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_HS_RXN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hstx contention rxn error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_HS_CONTP
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hstx contention contp error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_HS_CONTN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hstx contention contn error

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_IRQ_MASK1
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi interrupt mask this field is used to mask interrupt requests. if one bit is set to 0x1, the corresponding interrupt status is masked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_LAST_LINE
spirit:field.spirit:description: last line interupt

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_CPN_TE
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel tearing effect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_TA_TIMEOUT
spirit:field.spirit:description: turnaround acknowledge timeout for dphy

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_TIMEOUT
spirit:field.spirit:description: lp-rx timeout for dphy

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_TX_TIMEOUT
spirit:field.spirit:description: hs tx timeout for dphy

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_STATE_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: peripheral status error after dsi receives an ack with error report packet from slave, it will mark this bit if there is error status reported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi rx packet error dsi receives a packet from slave and the received packet has error status (ecc error/crc error/unknown packet)

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_FIFO_FULL_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx fifo full error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_PHY_FIFO_UNDERRUN
spirit:field.spirit:description: phy fifo underrun error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_REQ_CNT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx request count error the delays between an active panel tx request to the dphy ready are not consistent.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RXPSR_FIFO_FULL_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx parser fifo full error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_VPN_REQ_PHY_DLY_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn request delay error at phy interface vpn packets are delayed at the phy interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_VPN_BF_UNDERRUN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn buffer underrun error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_VPN_REQ_ARB_DLY_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn request delay error at arbiter interface vpn packets are delayed at arbiter point.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_VPN_BF_OVERRUN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn buffer overrun error

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_VPN_TIMING_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn data timing error pixel data may be incorrect. data fifo for vpn path is read too early or too late, and fifo is empty when it is read.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_VPN_VACT_DONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn vact done

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_VPN_BF_FULL
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn buffer full error pixel data may be incorrect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_CPN_BF_FULL
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpn buffer full error pixel data may be incorrect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_CONT_LP1
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy lp1 contention detect ppi errcontertionlp1

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_CONT_LP0
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy lp0 contention detect ppi errcontertionlp0

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_SYNC_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy sync error ppi errsyncesc, partial byte detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_ERR_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy invalid command detect ppi erresc, invalid esc command detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_DPHY_RX_LINE_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy invalid line state detect ppi errcontrol

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_TRG3
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy rx trigger 3 received by default, the value of trigger 3 is 0x05, and its meaning is not defined by specification.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_TRG2
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy rx trigger 2 received by default, trigger 2 is for acknowledge trigger, and its value is 0x84.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_TRG1
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy rx trigger 1 received by default, trigger 1 is for te trigger, and its value is 0xba.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_TRG0
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy rx trigger 0 received by default, trigger 0 is for reset trigger, and its value is 0x46.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_ULPS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy rx ulps received

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_RX_PKT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy rx packet received

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_CPN_TX_DONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel data transmission done

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_CPU_TX_DONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu packet transmission done

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_IRQ_MASK
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi interrupt mask this field is used to mask interrupt requests. if one bit is set to 0x1, the corresponding interrupt status is masked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_FCLK_REV
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy fclk reverse

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_TXRX_BYTECLK_REV
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy txrx_byteclk reverse

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSREQ_LANE3
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy lane3 hs requeset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSREQ_LANE2
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy lane2 hs requeset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSREQ_LANE1
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy lane1 hs requeset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSREQ_LANE0
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy lane0 hs requeset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSREQ_LANECLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy laneclk hs requeset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ENABLECLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy enable clk lane

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ENABLE1125
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy enable1

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ENABLE0126
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy enable0

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_MASSLVZ127
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy masterslaverz

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_TXRXZ
spirit:field.spirit:description: reserved for future use

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_RSTZCAL129
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy rstzcal

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_SHUTDOWN130
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy shutdown

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_RESETZ131
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy resetz

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ENABLE1139
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy lock

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ENABLE0140
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy testdout

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_MASSLVZ141
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy testdin

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_RSTZCAL143
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy testen

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_SHUTDOWN144
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy testclr

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_RESETZ145
spirit:field.spirit:description: fpga dphy testclk

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_CMD_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu command request 1 = cpu packet request 0 = no request or request done after software writes a command with this bit set to 1, the dsi module sends out a packet as requested. dsi de-asserts this field after packet is sent.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_SP
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu short packet 1 = cpu packet is a short packet 0 = cpu packet is a long packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_TURN
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu turn around 1 = after cpu packet, turn around the bus 0 = donâ€™t turn around bus after cpu packet

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_TXLP
spirit:field.spirit:description: low power tx for cpu packets 1 = transfer cpu packets through low power mode 0 = use high-speed mode to send cpu packets

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu packet byte count for high speed transfer, this is the payload byte count for long packets and doesn't include crc bytes. for high speed short packet transfer, this parameter is ignored. for low power transfer, this is the byte count for the whole packet transmission, including crc bytes, and cfg_cpu_sp is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TXLP_LPDT
spirit:field.spirit:description: lpdt tx enable lpdt tx enable signals for low power tx

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TXLP_ULPS
spirit:field.spirit:description: ulps tx enable ulps tx enable signals for low power tx

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TXLP_TRIGGER_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: low power tx trigger code

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_DAT_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu packet data buffer read/write request 1 = cpu packet data request 0 = no request or request done after software writes a command with this bit set to 1, the dsi module will write data to the packet data buffer or read data from the data buffer as requested. dsi will de-assert this bit after write/read operation is done. read data will be valid after this bit is reset to zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_DAT_RW
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu packet data buffer read/write operation 1 = cpu packet data write operation 0 = cpu packet data read operation

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_DAT_ADDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu packet data address this is the byte address for packet data. every write/read operation, 4 bytes of data will be written or read. software should increase address by 4 after each operation. packet data start from packet header. address 0: bits [7:0] are for type_id, bits [23:8] are for length, and bits [31:24] are for ecc. address 4: payload data if packet is a long packet, and so on. the maximum packet data buffer is 256 bytes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_WDAT
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu wdata 0 the dsi can generate packets based on cpu programmed data. this register defines the cpu packet data. this register is the cpu packet data to be written to the packet data buffer. software should program packet data to this register and then program the dsi cpu packet command register 3 to put the packet data into the tx packet data buffer. for every write/read operation, 4-byte data is written/read. bits [7:0] are the lsb and bits [31:24] are the msb. for packet data at address 0, bits [7:0] are for type_id, bits [23:8] are for length, and bits [31:24] are for ecc. for data at address 4, payload data if packet is a long packet, and so on. if packet is transmitted in high speed, hardware generates ecc and crc to replace this ecc/crc code in the packet data buffer. under low power tx, hardware does not insert ecc/crc and sends out the ecc/crc code in the packet data buffer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_PKT_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu packet counter this counter counts how many cpu packets are sent out through dsi. this register is write clear.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_CMD_TX_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu cmd tx counter this counter counts how many byte clock cycles it takes to transfer the current cpu command. it begins to count after cpu command is received, and stops to counter after dphy gets ready for another tx request. this counter could help to decide the cfg_l*_slot_**_cnt values of register 0x130, 0x134, 0x1b0, and 0x1b4.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPU_CMD_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpu cmd execution counter this counter counts how many byte clock cycles it takes to execute the current cpu command. this counter only counts the cycles which cpu engine is busy. this counter could help to decide the cfg_l*_slot_**_cnt values of register 0x130, 0x134, 0x1b0, and 0x1b4.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TXLP_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: low power tx byte clock count. this counter counts how many byte clock cycles it takes to transfer a low power packet.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_BTA_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: bus turn around byte clock count. this counter counts how many byte clock cycles it takes to do a bus turn around operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_STATUS_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel path status 1. {smt_bf_cnt[5:0], smt_fifo_bcnt[9:0], 3'b0, smt_cs[4:0], 2'b0, smt_wr_on, smt_dma_on, smt_fifo_empty, smt_bf_empty, smt_fifo_full_r, smt_bf_full_r}

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_TE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel tearing effect signal enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_RGB_TYPE
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel data rgb type 0x0 = 888 mode 0x1 = 666 unpacked mode 0x2 = 565 mode 0x3 = 444 mode 0x4 = 332 mode 0x5 = 111 mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_BURST_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel interface burst mode enable 0 = enable previous command pandel interface. 1 = burst mode interface between lcd and dsi will take effect. this interface is more efficient than the previous one.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_FIRSTP_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel first packet select 0 = fifo empty <1> vsync from dp650

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_DMA_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel dma_on disable 1 = disable smt_dma_on signal from lcd controller. dsi will not receive command panel interface data from lcd even smt_dma_on signal is active high. 0 = receive lcd command panel interface data when smt_dma_on is high.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_ADDR0_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel address bit indicator 0 = when smt_addr = 1, bus data are for pixel rgb data. when smt_addr = 0, bus data are ignored 1 = when smt_addr = 0, bus data are for pixel rgb data. when smt_addr = 1, bus data are ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DCS_LONGWR_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi command code for writing command panel data the default data is 0x39 from dsi specification.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DCS_WR_CON_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dcs command for continuous write the default value is 0x3c in mipi alliance standard for display command set specification.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DCS_WR_STR_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dcs command for first write the default value is 0x2c in the mipi alliance standard for display command set specification.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_PKT_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel packet length this field defines the packet length for command panel packets.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_FIFO_FULL_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel fifo full level, in byte count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_FRM_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: command panel frame counter this counter counts how many command panel frames are sent out through dsi. this register is write clear.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_ST_VLD
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 status valid 1 = valid status 0 = invalid status

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_ST_EOTP
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 is eotp 1 = received packet is eotp packet 0 = other packet it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_ST_ACK
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 is ack packet 1 = received packet is an ack packet with or without error 0 = other packet it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_ST_SP
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 short packet 1 = received packet is a short packet 0 = long packet it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_PKT_PTR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 data pointer packet header in fifo is the raw data from dphy and is before ecc correction. it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_VCH
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 virtual channel number it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_ECC_FLAGS
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 ecc error flags bit [11]: 1 = no ecc error 0 = ecc error bit [10]: 1 = correctable error in data bits bit [9]: 1 = correctable error happens at parity bits bit [8]: 1 = incorrectable error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_NO_CRC
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 without crc rx packet doesn't contain crc and crc part contain 0x0000. it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_UNKNOWN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 type unknown error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_ST_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 ack status error the ack packet has error status. the dsi_rx_pkt_hdr_0 should be checked to see what error happens. it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_ECC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 ecc error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet crc error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT0_HDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 0 header bits [7:0]: dataid bits [23:8]: length bits [31:23]: ecc--corrected if error detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_ST_VLD
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 status valid 1 = valid status 0 = invalid status

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_ST_EOTP
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 is eotp 1 = received packet is eotp packet 0 = other packet it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_ST_ACK
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 is ack packet 1 = received packet is an ack packet with or without error 0 = other packet it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_ST_SP
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 short packet 1 = received packet is a short packet 0 = long packet valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_PKT_PTR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 data pointer packet header in fifo is the raw data from dphy and is before ecc correction. valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_VCH
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 virtual channel number valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_ECC_FLAGS
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 ecc error flags bit [11]: 1 = no ecc error 0 = ecc error bit [10]: 1 = correctable error in data bits bit [9]: 1 = correctable error happens at parity bits bit [8]: 1 = incorrectable error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_NO_CRC
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 without crc rx packet doesn't contain crc and crc part contain 0x0000. it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_UNKNOWN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet type unknown error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_ST_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 ack status error the dsi_rx_pkt_hdr_0 should be checked to see what error happens. it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_ECC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 ecc error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 crc error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT1_HDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 1 header

spirit:register.spirit:name: DSI_RX_PKT_CTRL
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSI RX Packet Read Control Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT_RD_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet fifo read request 1 = read request 0 = invalid req this bit will be cleared to 0 after read operation is done and rx data valid.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT_RD_PTR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet data fifo read pointer for every read operation, the hardware will return the data from the pointer address. software must increment this pointer for the next data after each byte is read.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT_RD_DATA
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx fifo read data valid when rx_pkt_rd_req = 0. first byte: dataid second byte: wc0 third byte: wc1 fourth byte: raw ecc received from dphy, not corrected fifth byte and beyond: long packet data

spirit:register.spirit:name: DSI_RX_PKT_CTRL_1
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSI RX Packet Read Control 1 Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet count in rx fifo all lp rx packets are stored in the fifo and start from address 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT_BCNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx byte count in rx fifo the whole lp rx data are stored in the fifo and start from address 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_ST_VLD
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 status valid 1 = valid status 0 = invalid status

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_ST_EOTP
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 is eotp 1 = received packet is eotp packet 0 = other packet it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_ST_ACK
spirit:field.spirit:description:
rx packet 2 is an ack packet

1 = received packet is a ack packet with or without error 0 = other packet it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_ST_SP
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 short packet 1 = received packet is a short packet 0 = long packet valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_PKT_PTR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 data pointer packet header in fifo is the raw data from dphy and is before ecc correction. valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_VCH
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 virtual channel number valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_ECC_FLAGS
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 ecc error flags bit [11]: 1 = no ecc error 0 = ecc error bit [10]: 1 = correctable error in data bits bit [9]: 1 = correctable error happens at parity bits bit [8]: 1 = incorrectable error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_NO_CRC
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 without crc rx packet doesn't contain crc and crc part contain 0x0000. it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_UNKNOWN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 type unknown error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_ST_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 ack status error the dsi_rx_pkt_hdr_0 should be checked to see what error happens. it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_ECC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 ecc error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 crc error it is valid only when rx_pkt0_st_vld = 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_PKT2_HDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx packet 2 header

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_FIFO_AFULL_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi vpn fifo almost full count vpn fifo read_point - write_point shoud be greater than this value

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_HSYNC_MISSING_FIX
spirit:field.spirit:description: fix the hsync missing bug

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TXLP_LANE_TURN_FIX
spirit:field.spirit:description: fix the txlp lane turn bug

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_FIFO_AFULL_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: by pass vpn fifo almost full 0 = not bypass 1 = bypass, the lcd output pixel data to vpn fifo not care the almost full signal

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_VSYNC_EDGE
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpn vsync signal edge select 0 = posedge select 1 = negedge select

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_TE_EDGE
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpn tearing effect signal edge select 0 = posedge select 1 = negedge select

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_TE_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpn tearing effect mode select 0 = no tearing effect 1 = mode a, tearing effect signal consists of v-blanking only 2 = mode b, tearing effect signal consists of v-blanking and h-blanking 3 = mode c, tearing effect signal output the n h-blanking

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_PIXEL_SWAP
spirit:field.spirit:description: lcd output pixel swap 0 = don't swap lcd output pixel data 1 = swap lcd output pixel data

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SPLIT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: split mode enable, this bit should be set as same as lcd split mode 0 = split mode disable, just dsia is used for display 1 = split mode enable, both dsia and dsib are used for display

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_TE_DLY_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpn tearing effect delay count, the lcd output pixel data will delay cfg_cpn_te_dly_cnt cycles after te pulse

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CPN_TE_LINE_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpn tearing effect line count, when te_mode = 2, this field will take effect. the lcd output pixel data will wait for cfg_cpn_te_line_cnt te pulse

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TX_TIMER_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx transmission timer value this timer monitors the tx operation on the dsi output side. it could generate irq after timer timeout. by default setting, timeout will not happen because the reset value is the maximum value (0xffffffff).

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_RX_TIMER_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx timer value this timer monitors the rx operation on the dsi operation. it could generate irq after timer timeout. by default setting, timeout will not happen because the reset value is the maximum value (0xffffffff).

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TURN_TIMER_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: bus turn around timer value this timer monitors the turn around operation on the dsi. it could generate irq after timer timeout. by default setting, timeout will not happen because the reset value is the maximum value (0xffffffff).

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_DLY_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn vsync delay count in slave mode. in slave mode, dsi will start h/v timing depending on input vsync timing from lcd module. in slave mode, after dsi receives a vsync from lcd controller, it will start a vsync timing by delaying this count of clock.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_TX_DLY_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn tx delay count after dsi starts a hsync timing, delay this count of dphy byte clock count to start a vss packet transfer. this is a dsi internal delay to guarantee a fixed tx timing at dphy interface.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_VSYNC_RST_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: lcd vsync reset enable in slave mode 1 = reset dsi vertical state machine when lcd vsync comes. this will only take effect when lcd is in slave mode. 0 = don't reset dsi vertical state machine

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_AUTO_WC_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn auto word count disable this bit has lower priority than cfg_vpn_hact_wc_en 0x0 = enable auto word count calculation, and hardware automatically calculates how many bytes will be sent in each h line slot 0x1 = auto word count calculation will not be effective

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HACT_WC_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hact word count enable this bit has higher priority than cfg_vpn_auto_wc_en 0x0 = cfg_hact_wc will not be effective if cfg_vpn_auto_wc_dis is 0 0x1 = enable hact word count parameter, and cfg_hact_wc will be used to decide how many bytes are sent

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_TIMING_CHECK_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hss/hse/hact tx timing check disable 0x0 = check timing before requesting dphy for tx 0x1 = don't check timing before requesting dphy for tx

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_AUTO_DLY_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn auto vsync delay count disable 0x0 = enable auto vsync delay count calculation, and hardware will automatically use halt of cfg_htotal_cnt to replace cfg_vpn_dly_cnt 0x1 = auto vsync delay count disabled, hardware will use the cfg_vpn_dly_cnt for vsync delay

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HLP_PKT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: long blanking packet enable 1 = dsi will send out a long blanking packet during hlp time slot 0 = long blanking packet is disabled, dsi will go to low power during this time slot in most cases, this field should be programmed to 0x0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HEX_PKT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: extra long blanking packet enable 1 = dsi will send out a long blanking packet after pixel data transmission and before hfp 0 = extra long blanking packet is disabled, dsi will go to low power during this time slot in most cases, this field should be programmed to 0x0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HFP_PKT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: front porch packet enable 1 = dsi will send out a long blanking packet during hfp time slot 0 = hfp long blanking packet is disabled, dsi will go to low power during this time slot if front porch period is not long enough for dphy to go to low power state and come back to hs again timely for next hss packet, this field should be programmed to 0x1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HBP_PKT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: back porch packet enable 1 = dsi will send out a long blanking packet during hbp time slot 0 = hbp long blanking packet is disabled, dsi will go to low power during this time slot if back porch period is not long enough for dphy to go to low power state and come back to hs again timely for next pixel data packet, this field should be programmed to 0x1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HSE_PKT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: hse packet enable 1 = dsi will send out hse packet during hbp time slot 0 = hse packet is disabled, dsi will go to low power during this time slot enable this bit when transmission mode is in non-burst mode with sync pulse.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HSA_PKT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: hsa packet enable 1 = dsi will send out hsa long blanking packet during hbp time slot 0 = hsa packet is disabled, dsi will go to low power during this time slot if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync event or burst mode, this field should be disabled. if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync pulse, this field can be programmed to 0x1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HEX_SLOT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: extra long packet enable after pixel data 1 = enable extra long packet after pixel data transfer, this will insert a long blanking packet before hfp 0 = no extra long packet is inserted after pixel data transfer this field takes effect only in burst mode. in most cases, this field should be programmed to 0x0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_LAST_LINE_TURN
spirit:field.spirit:description: turn around bus at last h line 1 = dsi will turn around the bus every frame during the last h line, this will request slave to return an acknowledge or acknowledge with error 0 = dsi will not turn around the bus during the last h line in most cases, this field should be programmed to 0x0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_LPM_FRAME_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: go to low power every frame 1 = dsi will go to low power mode every frame during the last h line 0 = dsi will not go to low power mode during the last h line in most cases, this field should be programmed to 0x0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_BURST_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi transmission mode for lcd 1 0x0 = non-burst mode with sync pulse 0x1 = non-burst mode with sync event 0x2 = burst mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_RGB_TYPE
spirit:field.spirit:description: lcd 1 input data rgb mode for lcd 1 0x0 = 565 rgb mode 0x1 = 666 packet mode 0x2 = 666 un-packet mode 0x3 = 888 rgb mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HACT_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hact clock count in byte clock domain. this parameter defines the byte clock cycle numbers for horizontal line pixel data period the data byte number for this period is hact_byte_cnt = hact_cnt*lane_num

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HTOTAL_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn htotal clock count in byte clock domain. this parameter defines the byte clock cycle numbers for horizontal line period the data byte number for this period is htotal_byte_cnt = htotal_cnt*lane_num

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HSYNC_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hsync clock count in byte clock domain. this parameter defines the byte clock cycle numbers for horizontal line hsync period the data byte number for this period is hsync_byte_cnt = hsync_cnt*lane_num

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HBP_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hbp clock count in byte clock domain. this parameter defines the byte clock cycle numbers for horizontal line back porch period the data byte number for this period is hbp_byte_cnt = hbp_cnt*lane_num front porch clock count can be calculated by: hfp_cnt = htotal_cnt - hsync_cnt - hact_cnt - hbp_cnt the data byte number for front porch period is hfp_byte_cnt = hfp_cnt*lane_num

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_VACT_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn vact line count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_VTOTAL_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn vtotal line count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_VSYNC_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn vsync line count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_VBP_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn vbp line count

spirit:register.spirit:name: DSI_VPN_WC_0
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSI Video Panel Word Count Register 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HBP_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hbp packet payload data byte count this parameter must be programmed if hbp_pkt_en is 0x1, otherwise it can be kept as 0x0 if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync pulse, hbp_wc = hbp_byte_cnt - hse_byte_cnt(4) - hbp_pkt_overhead(6) if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync event or burst mode, hbp_wc = hsync_byte_cnt + hbp_byte_cnt - hss_byte_cnt(4) - hbp_pkt_overhead(6)

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HSA_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hsa packet payload data byte count this parameter must be programmed if hsa_pkt_en is 0x1, otherwise it can be kept as 0x0 if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync pulse, hsa_wc = hsync_byte_cnt - hss_byte_cnt(4) - hsa_pkt_overhead(6), otherwise it is 0x0

spirit:register.spirit:name: DSI_VPN_WC_1
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSI Video Panel Word Count Register 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HFP_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hfp packet payload data byte count this parameter must be programmed if hfp_pkt_en is 0x1, otherwise it can be kept as 0x0 if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync pulse, or non-burst mode with sync event, hfp_wc = hfp_byte_cnt - hact_pkt_overhead(6) - hfp_pkt_overhead(6) if transmission mode is burst mode and hex_pkt_en = 1, hfp_wc = hfp_byte_cnt - hact_pkt_overhead(6) - hfp_pkt_overhead(6) if transmission mode is burst mode and hex_pkt_en = 0, hfp_wc = hfp_byte_cnt + (hact_byte_cnt - hact_wc) - hact_pkt_overhead(6) - hfp_pkt_overhead(6)

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HACT_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hact packet payload data byte count this parameter is equal to active pixel rgb data total byte count

spirit:register.spirit:name: DSI_VPN_WC_2
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSI Video Panel Word Count Register 2

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HEX_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hex packet payload data byte count this parameter must be programmed if hex_pkt_en is 0x1, otherwise it can be kept as 0x0 if transmission mode is burst mode, hex_wc = hact_byte_cnt - hact_wc - hex_pkt_overhead(6) otherwise hex_wc = 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_HLP_WC
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn hlp packet payload data byte count this parameter must be programmed if hlp_pkt_en is 0x1, otherwise it can be kept as 0x0 if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync pulse, hlp_wc = htotal_byte_cnt - hsync_byte_cnt - hse_byte_cnt(4) - hlp_pkt_overhead(6) if transmission mode is non-burst mode with sync event or burst mode, hlp_wc = htotal_byte_cnt - hss_byte_cnt(4) - hlp_pkt_overhead(6)

spirit:register.spirit:name: DSI_VPN_SLOT_CNT_0
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSI Video Panel Time Slot Count 0 Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_SLOT_SP_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn time slot count for short packet. this parameter defines a min slot period for short packet transmission, which should ensure dphy can go to low power, send the short packet, and return to hs again in time for next active panel packet which has a strict timing requirement. if any dsi active panel data flow is working, and cpu or smart interface wants to send short packet between the active panel packets, the internal state machine will try to find a time slot between active panel packets which has a larger period than the defined value. dsi will only send cpu or command panel short packet during such slot to ensure dphy has enough time to go to low power, send the packet, and return to hs again in time for next active panel packet which has a strict timing requirement. the programming of his parameter is necessary only when multiple panels or data paths are working simultaneously.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_SLOT_LP_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn time slot count for long packet. this parameter defines a min slot period for long packet transmission, which should ensure dphy can go to low power, send the long packet, and return to hs again in time for next active panel packet which has a strict timing requirement. the programming of his parameter is necessary only when multiple panels or data paths are working simultaneously.

spirit:register.spirit:name: DSI_VPN_SLOT_CNT_1
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSI Video Panel Time Slot Count 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_SLOT_TXLP_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn time slot count for low power packet tx. this parameter defines a min slot period for low power packet transmission, which should ensure dphy can go to low power, send the low power packet, and return to hs again in time for next active panel packet which has a strict timing requirement. the programming of his parameter is necessary only when multiple panels or data paths are working simultaneously.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_SLOT_TN_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn time slot count for bus turn around. this parameter defines a min slot period for short packet transmission, which should ensure dphy can go to low power, turn around the bus, and return to hs again in time for next active panel packet which has a strict timing requirement.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_RD_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer read error. this includes cfg_vpn_rd_2early, cfg_vpn_line_miss, and cfg_vpn_rd_underrun.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_LINE_MISS
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer line miss. this indicates a whole h line pixel data missed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_RD_2EARLY
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer read too early

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_RD_UNDERRUN
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer underrun

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_BF_FULL
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer full

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_RD_DELAY_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn request delay error at arbiter

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_STATUS_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi vpn status register for debug purpose {l1_lcd[4:0]_cs, l1_vst[6:0], l1_hst[8:0]}

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_WRDONE_RDDONE_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer write done to input buffer read done clock count. this could help to tune the vsync delay count.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_WR2RD_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer write to input buffer read clock count. this could help to tune the vsync delay count.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_UNDERRUN_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer underrun count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_RD_DATWR_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn input buffer read to data write count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_REQ_ARB_DLY_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn tx req delay count at arbiter interface

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_REQ_PHY_DLY_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpn tx req delay count at dphy interface

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VPN_FRM_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dsi vpn tx frame count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_RX_TRG_REG_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: disable register for low power rx trigger signals. internal use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TX_LANE_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: new packet tx start from lane 0 =0 if two packets are transferred continuously, all data are packed and distributed to all enabled lanes the second packet could start from any lane 1 = transmission of every new packet starts from lane 0 if two packets are transferred continuously, and the first packet doesn't occupy all lanes, then extra byte of 0 will be inserted in at the end of first packet to ensure the second packet start from lane 0 this is an debug option and should be set to 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_FCLK_NOT
spirit:field.spirit:description: reverse the input byte clk from dphy to dsi control logic. the output data to dphy should be valid at falling edge of byte clk.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_STOP_ST_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy stop state count. for txlp and phy control

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_RX_DLY_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy rx_delay count. for rx control

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VDD_ANA_VALID
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy analog vdd valid

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_VDD_DVM_VALID
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy digital vdd valid

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_ULPS_REQ_BYTE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy all lane force to ulps

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TX_ULPS_CLK_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clk lane force to ulps

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CONT_CLK_HS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clock lane continuous clocking in hs

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_HSTX_RX_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx enable when dphy hstx 0x0 = disable 0x1 enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_LANE_MAP
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy data map to lane order 0x0 = lane0, lane1, lane2, lane3 0x1 = lane0, lane3, lane1, lane2 0x2 = lane0, lane2, lane3, lane1 = 0x3 reserved.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_LANE_RESC_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy lp receiver enable enable the reverse escape lp receiver. lane immediately transmits to receive mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_LANE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy data lane enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_LANE_TURN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy bus turn around this field indicates that the protocol desires to turn the lane around, allowing the other side to begin transmitting.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_FORCECLK_HIZ_HS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clk lane force to high-z in hs mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_FORCECLK_HIZ_LP
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clk lane force to high-z in lp mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_FORCE_HIZ_HS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy force data lane to high-z in hs mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_FORCE_HIZ_LP
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy data lane force to high-z in lp mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_RDY_HS_BYTE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hs tx ready signals

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_REQ_HS_BYTE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hs tx request signals

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_LINE_ERR653
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errcontrol illegal line state detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_SYNC_ESC654
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errsyncesc partial byte detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_ESC655
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi erresc invalid esc command detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_CONT_LP0656
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errcontentionlp0 contention detect

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_CONT_LP1657
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errcontentionlp0 contention detect

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ULP_STATE_BYTE
spirit:field.spirit:description: all lanes are ulps

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_STOP_STATE_BYTE
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi stopstate - all lanes in stop state

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_CLK_ULPS_ACTIVE_N
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi clock ulpsactivenot

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_RX_CLK_ULPS_N
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi rxulpsclknot

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_DIR
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi direction

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ULPS_ACTIVE_N
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi ulpsactivenot

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_LINE_ERR670
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errcontrol - illegal line state detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_ESC671
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi erresc - invalid esc command detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_SYNC_ESC672
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errsyncesc - partial byte detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_CONT_LP0673
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errcontentionlp0 - contention detect

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_ERR_CONT_LP1674
spirit:field.spirit:description: ppi errcontentionlp0 - contention detect

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_TRG3
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_trg3

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_TRG2
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_trg2

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_TRG1
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_trg1

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_TRG0
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_trg0

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_ULPS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_ulps

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_LPDT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_lpdt

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_DVALID
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_dvalid

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RX_CLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rx_clk

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_DOUT_RX
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_dout_rx

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_TX_TRIGGER_ESC_L
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx_trigger_esc[11:0]

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_TX_ULPS_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx_ulps_esc

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_TX_LPDT_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx_lpdt_esc

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_TX_VALID_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx_valid_esc

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_TX_REQ_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx_req_esc

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_LANE_RDY_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy_lane_rdy_esc

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_TX_TRIGGER_ESC_H
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx_trigger_esc[15:12]

spirit:field.spirit:name: DPHY_TX_DATA_ESC
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx_data_esc

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TX_REQ_CNT_R
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx previous req to rdy delay count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TX_REQ_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx req to rdy delay count

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_HS_EXIT
spirit:field.spirit:description: length of hs exit period in tx_clk_esc cycles this field is used for the time to drive lp-11 after hs burst. hs exit period = (1+cfg_csr_hs_exit)/66 mhz by default, dphy esc clock frequency is 66 mhz from mipi spec, the minimum value is 100 ns.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_HS_TRAIL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hs trail period length this field is used for the time to drive flipped differential state after the last payload data bit of a hs transmission burst. length of hs trail period is in tx_clk_esc cycles. hs trail time = (1 + cfg_csr_hs_trail)/66 mhz from mipi spec, the minimum value is defined by max (8*ui, 60 ns + 4*ui).

spirit:field.spirit:name: CDG_CSR_TIME_HS_ZERO
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hs zero state length this field is used for the time to drive hs-0 before the sync sequence. length of hs zero state is in tx_clk_esc cycles. hs zero state length >= (cfg_csr_time_zero - 2)/66 mhz + 3*tbyte_clk from mipi spec, the minimum value for (time hs prep + time hs zero) is 145 ns + 10*ui.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_HS_PREP
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hs prepare state length this field is used for the time to drive lp-00 to prepare for hs transmission. it is the length of hs prepare state period in tx_clk_esc cycles. time hs prep = (1+ cfg_csr_time_hs_prep)/66 mhz from mipi specification for dphy, the minimum value for this parameter is 40 ns + 4*ui, and the maximum value is 85 ns_6*ui.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_TA_GET
spirit:field.spirit:description: time to drive lp-00 by new transmitter in tx_clk_esc cycles ta get time = (1 + cfg_csr_time_ta_get)/66 mhz from mipi spec, the typical value is 5*tlpx, where tlpx is dphy lp length: tlpx = (1 + cfg_csr_time_lpx)/66 mhz

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_TA_GO
spirit:field.spirit:description: time to drive lp-00 after turn request in tx_clk_esc cycles ta go time = (1 + ta_go)/66 mhz from mipi spec, the typical value is 4*tlpx.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_WAKEUP
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hs wakeup period length this field is the recovery time from ultra-low power state (ulps). twakeup = (1 + cfg_csr_time_wakeup)/66 mhz from mipi spec, the minimum value is 1 ms.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_CK_EXIT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clk exit period length in tx_clk_esc cycles tck_exit = (1 + cfg_csr_time_ck_exit)/66 mhz this field should use the same value as cfg_csr_time_hs_exit

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_CK_TRAIL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clk trail period length in tx_clk_esc cycles this field is the time to drive hs differential state after the last payload clock bit of a hs transmission burst. clk trail time = (1 + cfg_csr_time_ck_trail)/66 mhz from mipi spec, the minimum value is 60 ns.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_CK_ZERO
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clk zero state length in tx_clk_esc cycles this field is the time for lead hs-0 drive period before starting the clock. tck_zero = (1 + cfg_csr_time_ck_zero)/66 mhz from mipi spec, the minimum value for (tck_prep+tck_zero) is 300 ns, where in <var product number> tck_prep is the same as time hs prep defined by cfg_cst_time_hs_prep.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_CK_LPX
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy clk lp length this field is the length of clk low power state period in tx_clk_esc cycles. clk lpx time = tck_lpx = (1 + cfg_csr_time_ck_lpx) / 66 mhz this field should be set to the same value as cfg_cst_time_lpx.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_LPX
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy lp length this field is the length of any low power state period in tx_clk_esc cycles. lpx time = tlpx = (1 + cfg_csr_time_lpx) / 66 mhz from mipi spec, the minimum value is 50 ns.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_TIME_REQRDY
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy hs req to rdy length this field is the minimum byte clock cycles of dsi hs tx request to dphy ready. sometimes it may be important for this length to be consistent to maintain precise vertical and horizontal timing. in most cases, this parameter should be kept at the default of 0x0. total cycles between dsi hs tx request to dphy ready is composed by dphy <q>clock lane timing,</q> <q>gap,</q> <q>data lane timing</q> and some other items inside dphy. clock lane timing = (2*(cfg_csr_time_ck_lpx + 1) + (cfg_csr_time_hs_prep + 1) + (cfg_csr_time_ck_zero + 1))/66 mhz gap = (16ui +2)/66 mhz data lane timing = ((2*cfg_csr_time_lpx + 1) + (cfg_csr_time_hs_prep + 1) + (cfg_csr_time_hs_zero + 1))/66 mhz (1 + cfg_csr_time_reqrdy)/frequecy_byte_clk = (clock lane timing + gap + data lane timing + 10/66 mhz) one other way to get a value for this parameter is to after dsi active panel data flow is running, read back the value of register dsi_phy_status_2 (0x1ac). bits [7:0] of this register is the current clock cycle value of delay between dsi tx request and dphy ready. add 2 to this value and program it to cfg_csr_time_reqrdy.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TRIG3_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy trigger 3 code

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TRIG2_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy trigger 2 code

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TRIG1_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy trigger 1 code

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_TRIG0_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy trigger 0 code

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_ULPS_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy ultra low power code

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CSR_LPDT_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy low power data transfer code

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ANA_RESETB
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy analog reset 0 = reaset dphy analog 1= de-reset dphy analog

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ANA_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy analog power up 0 = power down dphy analog 1= power up dphy analog

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_LPRX_VTTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: lprx reference voltage high 000: 760mv â€¦.. 20mv per stage 010: 800mv 111: 900 mv

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_LPRX_VTHL
spirit:field.spirit:description: lprx reference voltage low 000: 540mv â€¦.. 20mv per stage 010:580mv 011:600mv 111: 680 mv

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_LPTX_RES
spirit:field.spirit:description: lptx driver impedance control 000

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSTX_RES
spirit:field.spirit:description: hstx driver impedance control. 000: 120 ohm (differential @tt) 100: 100 ohm 111: 89 ohm

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSTX_LP
spirit:field.spirit:description: low power mode for hstx driver. 1 = lower power 0 = normal

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ADJ_DLY_CK
spirit:field.spirit:description: adjust delay of ch_ck hstx driver output to manage skew between channels. 30ps (@tt) per stage. 000: 0 stage 111: 7 stages

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_EN_CH_CK
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable for ch_ck. when disabled, ch_ck is power down mode, pad_ckp and pad_ckn are in high-z mode 0 = disable 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ADJ_DLY3
spirit:field.spirit:description: adjust delay of ch3 hstx driver output to manage skew between channels. 30ps (@tt) per stage. 000: 0 stage 111: 7 stages

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_EN_CH3
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable for ch3. when disabled, ch3 is power down mode, pad_dn3 and pad_p3 are in high-z mode 0 = disable 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ADJ_DLY2
spirit:field.spirit:description: adjust delay of ch2 hstx driver output to manage skew between channels. 30ps (@tt) per stage. 000: 0 stage 111: 7 stages

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_EN_CH2
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable for ch2. when disabled, ch2 is power down mode, pad_dn2 and pad_p2 are in high-z mode 0 = disable 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ADJ_DLY1
spirit:field.spirit:description: adjust delay of ch1 hstx driver output to manage skew between channels. 30ps (@tt) per stage. 000: 0 stage 111: 7 stages

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_EN_CH1
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable for ch1. when disabled, ch1 is power down mode, pad_dn1 and pad_p1 are in high-z mode 0 = disable 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_ADJ_DLY0
spirit:field.spirit:description: adjust delay of ch0 hstx driver output to manage skew between channels. 30ps (@tt) per stage. 000: 0 stage 111: 7 stages

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_EN_CH0
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable for ch0. when disabled, ch0 is power down mode, pad_dn0 and pad_p0 are in high-z mode 0 = disable 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_CLK_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dphy bit clk select 0 = pll_div output 1 = mipi_bit_clk mux output

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SWAP_PN_CH3
spirit:field.spirit:description: swap pn polarity for ch3

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SWAP_PN_CH2
spirit:field.spirit:description: swap pn polarity for ch2

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SWAP_PN_CHCK
spirit:field.spirit:description: swap pn polarity for ch ck

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SWAP_PN_CH1
spirit:field.spirit:description: swap pn polarity for ch1

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SWAP_PN_CH0
spirit:field.spirit:description: swap pn polarity for ch0

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SET_TEST
spirit:field.spirit:description: select analog phy self-test 1: enable phy self-test. at this mode, phybypass all control signal 0: disable phy self-test.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DFG_SET_TEST_LP
spirit:field.spirit:description: select lp or hs self-test mode. it only be valid when sel_test is high. 1: lp mode self test 0: hs mode self test

spirit:field.spirit:name: DFG_TEST_PATTERN
spirit:field.spirit:description: select self-test pattern generation 00: all 0 01: all 1 10: ck pattern (0101) 11: prbs7

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_EN_CLK_DIV2
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable half rate hstx mode. when enabled, phy will work at half data rate of pll input clock. 1: enable 0 disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_HSTX_VREF
spirit:field.spirit:description: hstx vreg control 000: 340mv â€¦.. 20mv per stage 011: 400mv 111: 480 mv

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_LPCDVTHH
spirit:field.spirit:description: lpcd reference voltage high 000: 300mv â€¦.. 20mv per stage 101:400mv 111: 440 mv

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_LPCDVTHL
spirit:field.spirit:description: lpcd reference voltage low 000: 200mv â€¦.. 20mv per stage 010: 240mv 111: 340 mv

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_PULL_DN
spirit:field.spirit:description: pull down enable: 1: enable pull down pad io for ch1,ch2,ch3,chck when both hstx and lptx are not enabled. 0: disable pull down pad io for ch1,ch2,ch3,chck when both hstx and lptx are not enabled. it's high z in this state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_DPHY_PULL_DN_CH0
spirit:field.spirit:description: pull down enable for ch0 1: enable pull down pad io when all hstx, lptx and lprx are not enabled. 0: disable pull down pad io when both hstx and lptx are not enabled. it's high z in this state.
